{{cpp/experimental/fs/title|copy_options}}
{{cpp/experimental/fs/navbar}}
{{dcl begin}}
{{dcl header|experimental/filesystem}}
{{dcl|since=fs_ts|1=
enum class copy_options {
    none = 0,
    skip_existing = 1,
    overwrite_existing = 2,
    update_existing = 4,
    recursive = 8,
    copy_symlinks = 16,
    skip_symlinks = 32,
    directories_only = 64,
    create_symlinks = 128,
    create_hard_links = 256
};
}}
{{dcl end}}

This type represents available options that control the behavior of the {{ltt|cpp/experimental/fs/copy|copy()}} and {{ltt|cpp/experimental/fs/copy_file|copy_file()}} function.

{{tt|copy_options}} satisfies the requirements of  {{named req|BitmaskType}} (which means the bitwise operators {{c|operator&amp;}}, {{c|operator{{!}}}}, {{c|operator^}}, {{c|operator~}}, {{c|operator&amp;{{=}}}}, {{c|operator{{!}}{{=}}}}, and {{c|operator^{{=}}}} are defined for this type).

===Member constants===
At most one copy option in each of the following options groups may be present, otherwise the behavior of the copy functions is undefined.
{|class="wikitable" style="text-align:left; font-size:85%; max-width:90em;"
|-
!Member constant
!Value
!Meaning
|-
!colspan=3|options controlling {{ltt|cpp/experimental/fs/copy_file|copy_file()}} when the file already exists
|-
|{{tt|none}} 
|{{c|0}}
|Report an error (default behavior).
|-
|{{tt|skip_existing}} 
|{{c|1}}
|Keep the existing file, without reporting an error.
|-
|{{tt|overwrite_existing}}
|{{c|2}}
|Replace the existing file.
|-
|{{tt|update_existing}}
|{{c|4}}
|Replace the existing file only if it is older than the file being copied.
|-
!colspan=3|options controlling the effects of {{ltt|cpp/experimental/fs/copy|copy()}} on subdirectories
|-
|{{tt|none}}
|{{c|0}}
|Skip subdirectories (default behavior).
|-
|{{tt|recursive}}
|{{c|8}}
|Recursively copy subdirectories and their content.
|-
!colspan=3|options controlling the effects of {{ltt|cpp/experimental/fs/copy|copy()}} on symbolic links
|-
|{{tt|none}}
|{{c|0}}
|Follow symlinks (default behavior).
|-
|{{tt|copy_symlinks}}
|{{c|16}}
|Copy symlinks as symlinks, not as the files they point to.
|-
|{{tt|skip_symlinks}}
|{{c|32}}
|Ignore symlinks.
|-
!colspan=3|options controlling the kind of copying {{ltt|cpp/experimental/fs/copy|copy()}} does
|-
|{{tt|none}}
|{{c|0}}
|Copy file content (default behavior).
|-
|{{tt|directories_only}}
|{{c|64}}
|Copy the directory structure, but do not copy any non-directory files.
|-
|{{tt|create_symlinks}}
|{{c|128}}
|Instead of creating copies of files, create symlinks pointing to the originals. Note: the source path must be an absolute path unless the destination path is in the current directory.
|-
|{{tt|create_hard_links}}
|{{c|256}}
|Instead of creating copies of files, create hardlinks that resolve to the same files as the originals.
|}
